manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: INNOPLUS ENCRYPTED FLASH DRIVE "New encryption performance upgrade" - with each u disk own unique product ID Some advantages: With an alphanumeric keypad that locks the drive with a word or number combination, for easy-to-use PIN protection.With rechargeable battery feature - Charging it full needs about 1.1-2 hours, and could be standby for about a month.

Crystal Digital Keypad Dust and Water resistant zinc alloy shell Upgrade Unique Product ID Military Grade Secure Key FIPS Validated and 256-bit AES-XTS Lanyard Hole High quality crystal texture buttons

Intelligent Encrypted Chip - Super anti-hacking technology Military Grade Secure Key FIPS Validated and 256-bit AES-XTS With an alphanumeric keypad that locks the drive with a word or number combination, for easy-to-use PIN protection. With rechargeable battery feature - Charging it full needs about 1.1-2 hours, and could be standby for about a month. Unique product ID - Never Lose Your Data even you forget your password! You could reset it a 10-bit dynamic password from us. And your original data will be kept as well.
STRONG COMPATIBILITY Compatible with Windows, Mac, Linux and other embedded systems.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heavy-Duty, easy to use, works as described.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this INNÔPLUS USB drive to store sensitive data for use with any future system I may have. It comes in a nice box with descriptive packaging, so it would make a nice gift. In the box are the USB drive, a cap for it, a lanyard, and an instruction manual. The USB drive and cap are surprisingly heavy metal. The buttons are clicky and responsive and just the right size. There is a button with a lightning bolt that doesn't click, and it's not even pictured in the instruction manual, so I have no idea what it's supposed to do. The other button has a key on it, and you hold that button down for 5 seconds to set a new password or press it once to enter your password, then press it again to confirm entry. Passwords must be between 6 and 14 digits and can't be consecutive digits like 123 or repeating digits like 000. It was very easy to set up and use, and the two different LED lights at the top make it clear what the USB drive is communicating. Most of all, it just works! The data is safe until you put in the passcode. If you lose your passcode, you have to contact the manufacturer with the serial number on the back, and they can give you a personalized code to wipe it and restore to factory settings.It worked with my Macbook, and I even tested it with a digital picture frame, and it worked! Overall, I didn't find any flaws with this product and would highly recommend it to anyone who needs to safely store data. 5/5 starsIf you found this review helpful, please show some love by clicking the Smiley Face button below. It really helps me to know which of my reviews you guys and gals like! Thanks for reading!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Came as described, easy to use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect security for sensitive documents.
reviews.reviewText: Great way to transport documents whilst traveling without a laptop..

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Need to keep backup on some other memory device.
reviews.reviewText: This item looked like the perfect device. I wanted something for long-term storage that could not be opened by anybody else. I put some stuff on it, and then put it aside since last November.A few days ago I tried to. open it. it wouldn't open. I communicated with the seller and got a "dynamic key" for use when a user has forgotten the password. I got it to go through all the steps so that it should have been ready to mount. It wouldn't mount. I used the Macintosh Disk Utility on it. The utility could see the drive even though it was not mounted.The seller was very helpful in getting me a dynamic password (on the assumption that I had passworded it and then forgot about it). When I tried the dynamic password it still would not work. After some extended email communication, they finally offered to send me a 16 GB device as a replacement. I got the new device, and so far it works o.k The good thing is that if you lose it, nobody else can open it. The bad thing is that if the unit fails, then you cannot get it to back-off your information.I don't know why they didn't send me the identical item. I didn't remember that the unit's box declared it to have a "5-years warranty," so I thought they were being generous to send me a drive with half the memory.I have two StarTech encrypted HD cases (you supply your own HD to mount inside). I keep one on my desk and one in my safe as back-up. I periodically update the one in the safe. Except for the size, this setup is a better deal for me.NB. When in the mode where it doesn't have a password set, mine wouldn't mount the way a regular thumb drive would. I found that I had to insert the drive and then press the "key" button on its case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Could be more secure
reviews.reviewText: My initial use for this was for a scavenger hunt style escape room game. The password on the physical drive itself is great but I could use an additional layer of unlocking using the computer keyboard when it is inserted into the USB slot. I have one drive that requires this without the physical keypad on the drive itself. It would be nice to have both. Kind of like having 2 factor authentication. When I put this in, it calls itself a mass storage device at 32 Gigs. I laughed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Please reconsider purchasing this item if it is for important storage!!! I am a therapist and I bought this encrypted USB as a way to securely store my files. It worked great for a year, but last week all of a sudden it would not allow me to unlock it (the red light would come on no matter what I pressed). I figured it was a small error and I could contact the company for a master code to get back in. Nope. I contacted the company and while I appreciate how responsive their customer service is, I was ultimately informed that there is an internal error and there is no way to fix it without mailing it back to China to be looked at by their team (which I cannot do because it would violate privacy laws of my clients since it is storing their protected information). A year’s worth of files are gone. Just gone. Please be cautious in buying this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Nice Product & EXCELLENT SELLER
reviews.reviewText: OK, So I purchased these for my office October 2019. They're working great. I've got one for Daily Use & One as my Backup Drive. Well the Daily Use drive just got wore out; it does a lot of overtime. So I was freaking out because I couldn't write to this drive anymore. Fortunately, I could still save the files to the Backup Drive & save all my information to the current date.So, now I'm using my Backup Drive as my Daily Use Drive since my Old Daily Use Drive wouldn't let me write to it anymore.So, naturally you can see that I would still need a New Backup Drive. So, I messaged the Seller & told them about my situation & the IMMEDIATELY sent me a new flash drive. FOR FREE. I REPEAT. FOR FREE.You couldn't ask for a better seller. Extremely happy with this product & the customer service.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Was really excited about this product, set my new password, can't remember it.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this item for examination security at my job - I got it in the mail the day of a vacation, was really excited, changed the passcode, but never used it. I cannot remember the passcode now and I threw away the users manual when I got it because ... it seemed like the only thing I needed that for was to set my passcode. Is there a digital users guide available? If not, is there a way to get the company to give me a code to reset it or something?Thanks much.As far as my review, it seems like a very well constructed (heavy) item that would be hard to lose, which is a huge bonus. Pretty excited to use it once I get to reset the passcode, will update my review when that happens.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 7, 2022

reviews.reviewText: This is definitely not your regular light plastic USB that you get from Costco. The moment you get it in your hand, it feels like Military Grade sensitive Data Drive.On top of it being Sleek and made of Solid heavy metal, The instruction manual is rather important. There's a very specific way to change the password, and you can't just tell by looking at the drive. You need those instructions !It's easy to set up, but you need to follow the instructions, that I'm positing here just in case I (Or you) loose the manual !1 - You need to hold the button down for 5 seconds to set a new password (or press it once to enter your password)2 - Enter the new password (Passwords must be between 6 and 14 digits and can't be consecutive digits like 123 or repeating digits like 000. )3 - Press it again to confirm entry.4 - Immediately re-enter the password and press to confirmIf the passwords match, you're set and good to go !If you loose your password, you have to contact the manufacturer with the serial number on the back, and they can give you a personalized code to wipe it and restore to factory settings.If you loose the Drive, who ever has it / or stole it can not access your data, as with a factory reset, all the data is wiped.
The drive is full metal encasement and the physical number pad for 15 digits encryptions is very reassuring.
I love this thing. I work with private documents and this is just what I needed.

The flash drive is a bit slow to use if you are working off of it daily. When I was moving documents to the flash drive from my desktop it happened to also delete a lot of my files in the process. I think I was dragging and dropping into the flash drive too fast and it just couldn't keep up? Overall it works fine...just slow to load documents if im searching on the device itself. Takes a while to load.
